article_title: Paul spokesman headed to consulting firm
article_text:
Brian Darling, a senior spokesman to prospective 2016 presidential candidate Sen. Rand Paul Rand PaulOvernight Defense: VA chief 'deeply' regrets Disney remark; Senate fight brews over Gitmo Paul ties release of 9/11 docs to defense bill Will Ted Cruz let it go? MORE (R-Ky.), is leaving his position effective immediately to work for a Washington, D.C., consulting company.

Darling told The Hill that he will be senior vice president at Third Dimension Strategies, a political consulting firm run by Republican strategist Jim Terry.

ADVERTISEMENT

“I have been honored to work for Senator Rand Paul over the past two years as both counsel and senior communications director," Darling told The Hill.

"I know him to be a principled and good-natured man. Although I am very excited for the new challenge with Third Dimension Strategies, I am going to miss the day-to-day fight for freedom with Team Paul."

Prior to working for Paul's office, Darling spent seven years at conservative think tank The Heritage Foundation as a senior fellow and director of government and state relations.
